blog.name: inikavulpixelreviews
blog.title: Let's Talk About Pokemon!
blog.description:
Reviewing my personal opinion on every single Pokemon! Yes, all 809 of them!
(Mostly) Daily Uploads, 3 PM EST.

summary: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Larvesta and Volcarona
title: Let’s Talk About Pokemon - Larvesta and Volcarona
body:
636: Larvesta

Gen 5 is a really kind generation for Bug types. We got some of the coolest ones to date in here, and to top em all off, we actually have a pseudo-legendary Bug! Larvesta is a pretty fun larval creature. A big, stumpy caterpillar covered in fuzz and with something of a sun motif going on. Further solidified by its Bug/Fire typing! All this line is really missing is a mid-stage pupae form. It’d be a really cool subversion of the usual Pokemon tropes if this generation’s caterpillar-into-butterfly/moth line was actually one of the most powerful Pokemon in the game that you can only get at the very end.

Personal Score: 8/10

A plenty good bug all the same!

637: Volcarona

But what we get anyways is still a really, really cool moth monster. Some cool insectoid eyes, a neat color scheme of sky blue with fiery oranges, and the sun motif made stronger with the big fiery wings. You could even call those black “freckles” sunspots! That’s so clever. And it’s big and fuzzy like an exotic moth too. Just lovely.

I also really like the idea that its scales, when shed, turn into embers. That’s a fun as hell idea for a Fire type moth creature, and one I’m surprised wasn’t done sooner. It seems so obvious once you think of it! And Volcarona definitely looks like it’d be a creature of myth, which it more or less is in the thing’s lore. The Pokedex goes so far as to say one shined bright enough to effectively replace the sun, lighting up a region that was engulfed in volcanic smoke for a time.

Personal Score: 9/10

Very cool bug!

Overall:

Shame we couldn’t get the full subversion effect with there being a pupa middle stage. Maybe, just maybe, they had the tiniest inkling for the idea of Cosmog all the way back then, but wanted to save that idea for an extra special occasion like a Legendary. That’s just spitballing, but hey. A really cool pair of bugs anyway.

[Archive]

[[MORE]]

blog.name: weirdandwackypokefusions
blog.title: Well that's strange!
blog.description:
Welcome!  I create, using the all-mighty classic Microsoft XP Paint, my own pokemon fusions. All the sprites come from pokestadium and usually people on deviantart/ the xy/sun&moon sprite project. I don't own any of the sprite used, I just fuse them! 
REQUESTS ARE OPEN! Ask Box: 3/15.
PLEASE FEEL FREE TO DRAW MY FUSIONS!!  I absolutely love it when people draw them! There's no need to ask either! Just make sure you tag me so them I can see it!
I hope you enjoy my fusions!

summary: Starduo Doduo and Staryu fusion Flying/Water Type Ability: Analytic/Early Bird Hidden Ability: Dual Heads - Any peck/beam moves...
caption:
Starduo

Doduo and Staryu fusion

Flying/Water Type

Ability: Analytic/Early Bird

Hidden Ability: Dual Heads - Any peck/beam moves are used twice.  The second hit does 30% of what the first head does.  

Stats: HP - 40, Atk - 85, Def - 50, SpA - 75, SpD - 45, Spe - 90

The Twin Star Pokemon

This pokefusion can’t fly all that well, but it can certainly swim as if it was flying.  It spins its heads around in the water like a propeller.  This means that it does tend to bump into things. 

Request for anon. I hope you like it!

tags: kinda dark for a kids game
summary: @ nintendo I have an idea for the next Pokémon game. I know they already had something like it with Pokémon Sun and Moon with...
body:
@ nintendo I have an idea for the next Pokémon game. I know they already had something like it with Pokémon Sun and Moon with Lusamine fusing with the ultra beast Nihilego but let’s take that further.

Let’s have an entire game where scientists are trying to fuse Pokémon DNA with human DNA to try and make the ultimate race of superhumans, where Pokémon wouldn’t be necessary anymore to keep the world going. Let’s have there be TONS of failures that the player has to fight or catch. The people infused could be anyone and any Pokémon, from starters to legends, and I mean that for both Pokémon and Humans.

Let the player question morals like in Pokémon Black and White with the question of “do Pokémon enjoy fighting?” but instead the question of “If we achieve that level of power, would it be worth the sacrifice of our failures?”.

If the scientists do accomplish their goal, will the creation be on their side or the side of their fallen and unsuccessful brethren like with MewTwo in the first movie?

Will the Player with able to fuse with their starter at some point, whether voluntary or not, in order to feel the pain and suffrage that the unsuccessful feel constantly? Or will the unsuccessful tell the player of their pain since they are still semi human, therefor may be capable of speech? Or will they be corrupted to their very soul, unable to rationalize their thinking and go purely on their Pokémon instinct? Will there be some that look like humans but act like Pokémon, such as a person hopping forever in order to keep its heart beating like a Spoink? Or will it be the opposite effect, like Meowth from the anime or other Pokémon that can talk?

In the end will the player be able to choose whether or not those beings have to live, choosing to spare their life or end their pain? Or will the ultimate creation decide what’s best for it and it’s broken family? Hell why not let the player BE that creation, and have the rest of the game having us live like a normal trainer, never telling anyone what we are?

So many lives would be lost for the sake of finding ultimate power, would it be worth it?

Or, ya know, remake Generation 4 ://

Use the gears up there to ask me stuff, send me stuff or to see a list of useful links. Have fun!

blog.name: pokegodsandmissingno
blog.title: P̵o̵K̸é̴G̸o̸D̷s̸ and Frightful Things to Come?
blog.description: There is a growing desire and expectation of humans here on Earth in making full contact with PoKéMoN who are still unknown. Back in 1995, when I saw my first UPM (Unindexed Pocket Monster), I found out very quickly that other people thought you were totally crazy if you said you saw such things. The world has changed quite a bit since then when I was a child. In fact, in late 1997, a poll taken in Kanto shows that for the first time ever, more than fifty percent of residents now believe in PokéGODS's. Since then, there have been polls that put the figure at over eighty percent or more.

blog.name: pokedexentries
blog.title: Pokedex Entries
blog.description: Pokedex Entries from all 7 gens

title: Sudowoodo - 185
body:
It stands along paths pretending to be a tree. If it starts raining, it seems to disappear.

- Pokemon Pearl
